intro: Leptosiphon melingii, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink to purple in color, blooming in the early morning. Its slender stems and small, alternate leaves are characteristic of the genus Leptosiphon. The plant is often found in disturbed areas and is known for its rapid growth and short life cycle.
